newsitem.title: SPAIN: Iberdrola, Telefonica in services JV.
newsitem.headline: Iberdrola, Telefonica in services JV.

text.p: Key Spanish firms Telefonica de Espana and electricity giant Iberdrola have agreed a joint venture to develop value-added services, a press statement from the two firms said on Thursday.
The deal foresees the joint development of cable television activities.
It also contemplates collaboration on unspecified activities in Latin America.

The joint venture will operate within the engineering and value-added services design areas, the statement said. Iberdrola will also become part of the Telyco/Telespacio unit's capital, the statement said.
No valuation for the unit was given.
The deal allows Iberdrola's entry into Telefonica units Cabitel and telemarketing unit Estratel, and the firms will set out retailing and marketing strategies.
The deal was contemplated in a strategic telecoms agreement between the two firms in January 1996.
